intro: Rhynchospora heterolepis, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower spikes that are typically pale green to brownish in color. It thrives in moist to wet soils and is often found in marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. Rhynchospora heterolepis plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various invertebrates and birds.
